TopicTitle: WHEELS OF MY ROVER ARE STUCK AND THE ROVER IS NOT MOVING

Articles.Content:
SCREENSHOT -  https://imgur.com/a/rseThuo

ANYONE PLEASE HELP ME IN THIS SITUATION
Try Timewarping, it might reset the rover on the ground.

Just to confirm- your rover has power, the control point is pointing forwards, the brakes are off and the wheel motors are switched on? Try moving its position a bit with the set position cheat and see if that helps.

The wheels in the photo are not mounted in the correct orientation.

It’s annoying, but when placing wheels in the SPH they often default to an incorrect rotation orientation.  You need to either manually rotate them before placing, or use the rotate tool after placing them.

Visually, the wheels are round, so it is easy to assume they will function in any orientation.  Unfortunately, that is not the case.

Agree with the previous answer. The SPH puts the wheels sideways. When attaching the wheels, make sure the fat side of the attaching part on the wheel is pointing upward. In your picture they are pointed forward (i think)
